gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10-11 - dFe and dFe-II from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Concentrations of dissolved iron and dissolved iron(II), U.S. GEOTRACES transects Dataset Description: <p>Concentrations of dissolved iron and dissolved iron(II) in water-column samples from major stations occupied during first and second legs of the U.S. GEOTRACES North Atlantic zonal transect cruises.</p><p><strong>Note</strong>: Data is not to be released until the end of 2013. Contact PI for access prior to release. These data should be considered and cited as preliminary through the end of 2013.</p><p>Please note that data may not be final, pending intercalibration&nbsp;results and further analysis. If you are interested in following&nbsp;changes to US GEOTRACES data, there is an RSS feed available&nbsp;from the <a href="http://www.bco-dmo.org/project/2066" target="_blank">GEOTRACES-NAT</a> project page.</p> Acquisition Description: <p><strong>Sample collection and processing: </strong><br />Water-column samples for trace metal analysis were collected in modified 12 L Teflon-lined GO-FLO samplers (General Oceanics Inc.), deployed on the U.S. GEOTRACES clean CTD rosette system with a total of 24 samplers. All samples were filtered as soon as possible after recovery by GEOTRACES sampling personnel using 0.2 µm Supor Acropak filter cartridge (Pall Corp.) inside the U.S. GEOTRACES clean-air laboratory van. Near-surface samples (from ~2 m depth) were collected while underway on approach to each station using the Bruland-Smith trace-metal towfish, which was towed outside of the ship’s wake. Seawater from the towfish was pumped directly into a clean-air laboratory van, where it was filtered through 0.2 µm Supor Acropak filter cartridges.</p><p><strong>Dissolved iron (dFe) analysis: </strong><br />The filtered seawater samples were collected in 125 mL acid-cleaned Nalgene wide-mouth low-density polyethylene bottles, acidified to pH ~1.7 with Fisher Optima grade ultrapure hydrochloric acid, and then stored at room temperature until post-cruise analysis at Old Dominion University by Bettina Sohst. Dissolved iron was determined by flow injection analysis with colorimetric detection after in-line preconcentration on resin-immobilized 8-hydroxyquinoline [Sedwick et al., 2005, 2008], using a method modified from Measures et al. [1995]. The efficacy of our analytical method for dFe was verified through the analysis of the SAFe seawater reference materials. Over the period during which these samples were analyzed (2010-2012), we determined mean dFe values of 0.122 ± 0.021 nM (n = 7) for SAFe seawater reference material S and 1.13 ± 0.19 nM (n = 2) for SAFe seawater reference material D2, versus community consensus values of 0.095 ± 0.008 nM and 0.955 ± 0.024 nM, respectively (as of May 2013). The analytical limit of detection is estimated as the dFe concentration equivalent to a peak area that is three times the standard deviation on the "zero-loading blank" (or "manifold blank"), from which we estimate a detection limit of less than 0.04 nM [Bowie et al., 2004; Sedwick et al., 2005]. Blank contributions from the ammonium acetate sample buffer solution (added on-line during analysis) and hydrochloric acid (added after collection) are typically negligible (i.e., too low to quantify). Robust estimates of our analytical precision are derived from multiple (separate-day) determinations of the SAFe seawater reference materials, which yield analytical uncertainties (expressed as ± one relative sample standard deviation on the mean) of ±14.7% (n = 33) at the concentration level of SAFe S seawater (0.095 nM), and ±9.2% (n = 16) at the concentration level of SAFe D2 seawater (0.955 nM).<br /><br /><strong>Dissolved iron(II) (dFe(II)) analysis: </strong><br />The filtered seawater samples were transported from the sampling station to a shipboard clean-air laboratory van in a cooler, and were analyzed at sea by Bettina Sohst as soon as possible after sampling. Dissolved iron(II) was determined by flow injection analysis with in-line preconcentration modified after the method of Bowie et al. [2005]. The analytical limit of detection was estimated daily as the dFe(II) concentration corresponding to a signal three times the standard deviation on triplicate analyses of the blank [Bowie et al., 2004; Sarthou et al., 2011]. For the blank solution, we used filtered, aged, low-iron seawater that was stored in the dark ("low Fe(II) seawater"), for which the chemiluminescence signal was analytically indistinguishable from reagents injected without seawater [see Bowie et al., 2005]. <strong>KN199-04:</strong> The limit of detection averaged &lt;0.06 nM for all of the daily shipboard analyses (n = 16). <strong>KN204-01:</strong> The limit of detection averaged &lt;0.01 nM for all of the daily shipboard analyses (n = 31).</p><p>There is no standard reference material for the determination of dissolved iron(II) in seawater, thus we are unable to provide rigorous estimates of the accuracy and precision of the dFe(II) determinations. However, some indication of our analytical uncertainty is provided by repeat measurements of standards prepared in low-Fe(II) seawater, which yielded average relative standard deviations of &lt;17% (KN199-04) or &lt;13% (KN204-01) and &lt;11% for triplicate injections of 0.2 nM and 0.4 nM dFe(II) standards, respectively.</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br />Bowie, A. R., P. N. Sedwick, and P. J. Worsfold (2004), Analytical intercomparison between flow injection-chemiluminescence and flow injection-spectrophotometry for the determination of picomolar concentrations of iron in seawater, Limnology &amp; Oceanography Methods, 2, 42-54. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2004.2.42" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2004.2.42</a>.<br /><br />Bowie, A. R., E. P. Achterberg, S. Ussher, and P. J. Worsfold (2005), Design of an automated flow injection-chemiluminescense instrument incorporating a miniature photomultiplier tube for monitoring picomolar concentrations of iron in seawater, Journal of Automated Methods &amp; Management in Chemistry, 2, 37-43. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1155/JAMMC.2005.37" target="_blank">10.1155/JAMMC.2005.37</a>.<br /><br />Measures, C. I., J. Yuan, and J. A. Resing (1995), Determination of iron in seawater by flow injection analysis using in-line preconcentration and spectrophotometric detection, Marine Chemistry, 50, 3-12. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/0304-4203(95)00022-J" target="_blank">10.1016/0304-4203(95)00022-J</a>.<br /><br />Sarthou, G., E. Bucciarelli, F. Chever, S. P. Hansard, M. González-Dávila, J. M. Santana-Casiano, F. Planchon, and S. Speich (2011), Labile Fe(II) concentrations in the Atlantic sector of the Southern Ocean along a transect from the subtropical domain to the Weddell Sea Gyre, Biogeosciences, 8, 2461-2479, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5194/bg-8-2461-2011" target="_blank">10.5194/bg-8-2461-2011</a>.<br /><br />Sedwick, P. N., T. M. Church, A. R. Bowie, C. M. Marsay, S. J. Ussher, K. M. Achilles, P. J. Lethaby, R. J. Johnson, M. M. Sarin, and D. J. McGillicuddy (2005), Iron in the Sargasso Sea (Bermuda Atlantic Time-series Study region) during summer: Eolian imprint, spatiotemporal variability, and ecological implications, Global Biogeochemical Cycles, 19, GB4006, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1029/2004GB002445" target="_blank">10.1029/2004GB002445</a>.<br /><br />Sedwick, P. N., A. R. Bowie, and T. W. Trull (2008), Dissolved iron in the Australian sector of the Southern Ocean (CLIVAR-SR3 section): meridional and seasonal trends, Deep-Sea Research I, 55, 911-925, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.dsr.2008.03.011" target="_blank">10.1016/j.dsr.2008.03.011</a>.</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by NSF Ocean Sciences (NSF OCE) Award Number: OCE-0927285 Award URL: http://www.nsf.gov/awardsearch/showAward.do?AwardNumber=0927285

gmd:deliveryPoint.gco:CharacterString: Ocean, Earth & Atmospheric Sciences 4600 Elkhorn Ave.

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37208.rdf Name: cruise_id Units: text Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37210.rdf Name: station_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Some GeoFish stations are denoted as X_to_Y indicating the tow occurred between stations X and Y. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37211.rdf Name: cruise_part Units: alphanumeric Description: Part of cruise. For KN204-01: A = 11/6/2011 to 11/18/2011 (Woods Hole to Bermuda); B = 11/19/2011 to 12/11/2011 (Bermuda to Praia Cabo Verde) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37212.rdf Name: cruise_name Units: text Description: Name chosen by project investigators for the research expedition as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37213.rdf Name: lat_sta Units: decimal degrees Description: Station latitude; north is positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37214.rdf Name: lon_sta Units: decimal degrees Description: Station longitude; east is positive. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37216.rdf Name: depth_GEOTRC_CTD Units: meters Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37217.rdf Name: event_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37218.rdf Name: cast_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37219.rdf Name: sample_GEOTRC Units: integer Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Sample ID', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37220.rdf Name: sample_bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37221.rdf Name: bottle_GEOTRC Units: dimensionless Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g. NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37222.rdf Name: lat_cast Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude when sampling cast was started; north is positive (nd = underway sample collected on approach to station using towfish; exact coordinates not available). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37223.rdf Name: lon_cast Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude when sampling cast was started; west is negative (nd = underway sample collected on approach to station using towfish; exact coordinates not available). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37224.rdf Name: year Units: YYYY Description: year when cast was started http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37225.rdf Name: month Units: 1 to 12 Description: month when cast was started (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37226.rdf Name: day Units: 1 to 31 Description: day when cast was started (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37227.rdf Name: yrday_gmt Units: 1 to 365 Description: year-day when cast was started (UTC). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37228.rdf Name: dFe Units: nanomoles/liter (nM) Description: dissolved iron concentration http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37229.rdf Name: dFe_corr Units: nanomoles/liter (nM) Description: Corrected dissolved iron concentration based on difference between mean values determined for SAFe reference seawater materials S and D2 and community consensus values (details are presented under the heading 'Dissolved iron analysis' under 'Acquisition Description'). The linear-fit correction is: dFe-corr = 0.853dFe - 0.009 nM http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37230.rdf Name: sigma_dFe_corr Units: nanomoles/liter (nM) Description: "Estimated analytical uncertainty (1 standard deviation) on dFe-corr as estimated from the percent relative standard deviation (RSD) on the mean of repeat determinations of the SAFe seawater reference materials S and D2 (details are presented under the heading 'Dissolved iron analysis' under 'Acquisition Description'). A linear fit of %RSD versus reference seawater concentration is used to estimate RSD values for dFe-corr values of less than or equal to 0.96 nM [equation: %RSD = 15.5 - 6.66(dFe-corr)] whereas a constant RSD of 9.2% is applied to dFe-corr values > 0.96 nM. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37231.rdf Name: dFe_flag Units: integer Description: Dissolved iron data quality flag: 2=good; 9=missing data http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37232.rdf Name: dFe_II Units: nanomoles/liter (nM) Description: dissolved iron(II) concentration http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37233.rdf Name: dFe_II_flag Units: integer Description: Dissolved iron(II) data quality flag: 2=good; 3=questionable: below limit of detection; 9=missing data http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37234.rdf Name: comments Units: text Description: Comments pertaining to the data. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37235.rdf Name: BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC Units: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS[.xx][+/-TZ] Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time) http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/37236.rdf Name: date Units: YYYYmmdd Description: Sample collection date (UTC).

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: GB/NERC/BODC > British Oceanographic Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council, United Kingdom

gmd:citedResponsibleParty.xlink:title: GB/NERC/BODC > British Oceanographic Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council, United Kingdom

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P02/current/ACYC/ Name: Reference numbers Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/YEARXXXX/ Name: Year since birth of Christ Description: The number of Gregorian calendar years that have elapsed since the birth of Christ. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DAYXXXXX/ Name: Day within month Description: A digit from 1 through 28, 29, 30 or 31 representing the number of whole days that have elapsed within a calendar month plus one. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P01/current/DTUT8601/ Name: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision) Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Official cruise identifier e.g. KN199-04 = R/V Knorr cruise number 199-04.; General Description: cruise designation; name

PI-supplied Description: GEOTRACES station number; ranges from 1 through 12 for KN199-04 and 1 through 24 for KN204-01. Stations 7 and 9 were skipped on KN204-01. Some GeoFish stations are denoted as X_to_Y indicating the tow occurred between stations X and Y. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Part of cruise. For KN204-01: A = 11/6/2011 to 11/18/2011 (Woods Hole to Bermuda); B = 11/19/2011 to 12/11/2011 (Bermuda to Praia Cabo Verde); General Description: Identifier for a segment of a leg of a cruise, where a leg may have been broken into parts.

PI-supplied Description: Name chosen by project investigators for the research expedition as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.; General Description: The cruise_name is a local name chosen by project investigators for a research expedition on a vessel, as opposed to the formal/official cruise ID asserted by the vessel operator.

PI-supplied Description: Station latitude; north is positive.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Station longitude; east is positive.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Observation/sample depth in meters; calculated from CTD pressure. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES sampling events; ranges from 2001 to 2225 for KN199-04 events and from 3001 to 3282 for KN204-01 events. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: event or operation number; often derived from date/time (MMDDHHmm) of sampling and when combined with year (YYYY) is a unique sampling identifier/data processing key. Date/time is not necessarily in GMT.

PI-supplied Description: Cast identifier numbered consecutively within a station. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: cast or profile number

PI-supplied Description: Unique identifying number for US GEOTRACES samples; ranges from 5033 to 6078 for KN199-04 and from 6112 to 8148 for KN204-01. PI-supplied values were identical to those in the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file. Originally submitted as 'Sample ID', this parameter name has been changed to conform to BCO-DMO's GEOTRACES naming conventions.; General Description: unique sample identification or number; any combination of alpha numeric characters; precise definition is file dependent NERC Description: Data record, event, sample or measurement reference numbers

PI-supplied Description: Unique identification numbers given to samples taken from bottles; ranges from 1 to 24; often used synonymously with bottle number. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: Niskin sample bottle number

PI-supplied Description: Alphanumeric characters identifying bottle type (e.g. NIS representing Niskin and GF representing GOFLO) and position on a CTD rosette. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description).; General Description: water bottle number, generally assigned to a position on a CTD rosette, identifies all samples drawn from a given bottle

PI-supplied Description: Latitude when sampling cast was started; north is positive (nd = underway sample collected on approach to station using towfish; exact coordinates not available).; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude when sampling cast was started; west is negative (nd = underway sample collected on approach to station using towfish; exact coordinates not available).; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: year when cast was started; General Description: year, reported as YYYY, e.g. 1995 NERC Description: The number of Gregorian calendar years that have elapsed since the birth of Christ.
PI-supplied Description: month when cast was started (UTC).; General Description: month of year, utc time, Use month_gmt for future data sets.

PI-supplied Description: day when cast was started (UTC).; General Description: day of month; numeric 1 to 31 NERC Description: A digit from 1 through 28, 29, 30 or 31 representing the number of whole days that have elapsed within a calendar month plus one.

PI-supplied Description: year-day when cast was started (UTC).; General Description: GMT day and decimal time, as 326.5 for the 326th day of the year, or November 22 at 1200 hours (noon). In the case of drifter data, year day may be continuous over a multi year period.
PI-supplied Description: dissolved iron concentration; General Description: iron; dissolved less than 0.2 microns

PI-supplied Description: Corrected dissolved iron concentration based on difference between mean values determined for SAFe reference seawater materials S and D2 and community consensus values (details are presented under the heading 'Dissolved iron analysis' under 'Acquisition Description'). The linear-fit correction is: dFe-corr = 0.853dFe - 0.009 nM; General Description: iron; dissolved less than 0.2 microns

PI-supplied Description: "Estimated analytical uncertainty (1 standard deviation) on dFe-corr as estimated from the percent relative standard deviation (RSD) on the mean of repeat determinations of the SAFe seawater reference materials S and D2 (details are presented under the heading 'Dissolved iron analysis' under 'Acquisition Description'). A linear fit of %RSD versus reference seawater concentration is used to estimate RSD values for dFe-corr values of less than or equal to 0.96 nM [equation: %RSD = 15.5 - 6.66(dFe-corr)] whereas a constant RSD of 9.2% is applied to dFe-corr values > 0.96 nM.; General Description: Iron error; file dependent; refer to data documentation for units and definition

PI-supplied Description: Dissolved iron data quality flag: 2=good; 9=missing data; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: dissolved iron(II) concentration; General Description: iron; dissolved less than 0.2 microns

PI-supplied Description: Dissolved iron(II) data quality flag: 2=good; 3=questionable: below limit of detection; 9=missing data; General Description: Data flag. Multiple uses which are dataset dependent. Some uses: data quality, collection occurance or success, depth indicator. See dataset documentation for specific details
PI-supplied Description: Comments pertaining to the data.; General Description: association with a community-wide standard parameter is not yet defined

gco:attributeType.xlink:title: Date and time (UT in ISO8601 format to sub-second precision)

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Date and time (UTC) variable recorded at the bottle sampling time in ISO compliant format. Values were added from the intermediate US GEOTRACES master file (see Processing Description). This standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on the following form: 2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time); General Description: Date/Time (UTC) ISO formattedThis standard is based on ISO 8601:2004(E) and takes on any of the following forms:2009-08-30T09:05:00[.xx] (local time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]-05:00The dashes and the colons can be dropped.The T can also be dropped "by mutual agreement", but one needs the trailing Z if the time is UTC.Sample ISO_datetime_utc:2009-08-30T14:05:00[.xx]Z (UTC time)Format: YYYY-mm-ddTHH:MM:SS[.xx]Z (UTC time) NERC Description: String corresponding to format 'yyyy-mm-ddThh:mi:ss.sss' optionally terminated by 'Z'

PI-supplied Description: Sample collection date (UTC).; General Description: UTC month, day and year, usually as a text string, e.g. feb10_1995. It is better to use one of the other forms of presenting date and time data so that the data can be used in computations and for comparisons. Note, if the string begins with numbers but also includes letters, there may be problems using the field name for retrieval. Use date_gmt for future data sets.

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <p><strong>Sample collection and processing: </strong><br />Water-column samples for trace metal analysis were collected in modified 12 L Teflon-lined GO-FLO samplers (General Oceanics Inc.), deployed on the U.S. GEOTRACES clean CTD rosette system with a total of 24 samplers. All samples were filtered as soon as possible after recovery by GEOTRACES sampling personnel using 0.2 µm Supor Acropak filter cartridge (Pall Corp.) inside the U.S. GEOTRACES clean-air laboratory van. Near-surface samples (from ~2 m depth) were collected while underway on approach to each station using the Bruland-Smith trace-metal towfish, which was towed outside of the ship’s wake. Seawater from the towfish was pumped directly into a clean-air laboratory van, where it was filtered through 0.2 µm Supor Acropak filter cartridges.</p><p><strong>Dissolved iron (dFe) analysis: </strong><br />The filtered seawater samples were collected in 125 mL acid-cleaned Nalgene wide-mouth low-density polyethylene bottles, acidified to pH ~1.7 with Fisher Optima grade ultrapure hydrochloric acid, and then stored at room temperature until post-cruise analysis at Old Dominion University by Bettina Sohst. Dissolved iron was determined by flow injection analysis with colorimetric detection after in-line preconcentration on resin-immobilized 8-hydroxyquinoline [Sedwick et al., 2005, 2008], using a method modified from Measures et al. [1995]. The efficacy of our analytical method for dFe was verified through the analysis of the SAFe seawater reference materials. Over the period during which these samples were analyzed (2010-2012), we determined mean dFe values of 0.122 ± 0.021 nM (n = 7) for SAFe seawater reference material S and 1.13 ± 0.19 nM (n = 2) for SAFe seawater reference material D2, versus community consensus values of 0.095 ± 0.008 nM and 0.955 ± 0.024 nM, respectively (as of May 2013). The analytical limit of detection is estimated as the dFe concentration equivalent to a peak area that is three times the standard deviation on the "zero-loading blank" (or "manifold blank"), from which we estimate a detection limit of less than 0.04 nM [Bowie et al., 2004; Sedwick et al., 2005]. Blank contributions from the ammonium acetate sample buffer solution (added on-line during analysis) and hydrochloric acid (added after collection) are typically negligible (i.e., too low to quantify). Robust estimates of our analytical precision are derived from multiple (separate-day) determinations of the SAFe seawater reference materials, which yield analytical uncertainties (expressed as ± one relative sample standard deviation on the mean) of ±14.7% (n = 33) at the concentration level of SAFe S seawater (0.095 nM), and ±9.2% (n = 16) at the concentration level of SAFe D2 seawater (0.955 nM).<br /><br /><strong>Dissolved iron(II) (dFe(II)) analysis: </strong><br />The filtered seawater samples were transported from the sampling station to a shipboard clean-air laboratory van in a cooler, and were analyzed at sea by Bettina Sohst as soon as possible after sampling. Dissolved iron(II) was determined by flow injection analysis with in-line preconcentration modified after the method of Bowie et al. [2005]. The analytical limit of detection was estimated daily as the dFe(II) concentration corresponding to a signal three times the standard deviation on triplicate analyses of the blank [Bowie et al., 2004; Sarthou et al., 2011]. For the blank solution, we used filtered, aged, low-iron seawater that was stored in the dark ("low Fe(II) seawater"), for which the chemiluminescence signal was analytically indistinguishable from reagents injected without seawater [see Bowie et al., 2005]. <strong>KN199-04:</strong> The limit of detection averaged &lt;0.06 nM for all of the daily shipboard analyses (n = 16). <strong>KN204-01:</strong> The limit of detection averaged &lt;0.01 nM for all of the daily shipboard analyses (n = 31).</p><p>There is no standard reference material for the determination of dissolved iron(II) in seawater, thus we are unable to provide rigorous estimates of the accuracy and precision of the dFe(II) determinations. However, some indication of our analytical uncertainty is provided by repeat measurements of standards prepared in low-Fe(II) seawater, which yielded average relative standard deviations of &lt;17% (KN199-04) or &lt;13% (KN204-01) and &lt;11% for triplicate injections of 0.2 nM and 0.4 nM dFe(II) standards, respectively.</p><p><strong>References:</strong><br />Bowie, A. R., P. N. Sedwick, and P. J. Worsfold (2004), Analytical intercomparison between flow injection-chemiluminescence and flow injection-spectrophotometry for the determination of picomolar concentrations of iron in seawater, Limnology &amp; Oceanography Methods, 2, 42-54. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.4319/lom.2004.2.42" target="_blank">10.4319/lom.2004.2.42</a>.<br /><br />Bowie, A. R., E. P. Achterberg, S. Ussher, and P. J. Worsfold (2005), Design of an automated flow injection-chemiluminescense instrument incorporating a miniature photomultiplier tube for monitoring picomolar concentrations of iron in seawater, Journal of Automated Methods &amp; Management in Chemistry, 2, 37-43. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1155/JAMMC.2005.37" target="_blank">10.1155/JAMMC.2005.37</a>.<br /><br />Measures, C. I., J. Yuan, and J. A. Resing (1995), Determination of iron in seawater by flow injection analysis using in-line preconcentration and spectrophotometric detection, Marine Chemistry, 50, 3-12. doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/0304-4203(95)00022-J" target="_blank">10.1016/0304-4203(95)00022-J</a>.<br /><br />Sarthou, G., E. Bucciarelli, F. Chever, S. P. Hansard, M. González-Dávila, J. M. Santana-Casiano, F. Planchon, and S. Speich (2011), Labile Fe(II) concentrations in the Atlantic sector of the Southern Ocean along a transect from the subtropical domain to the Weddell Sea Gyre, Biogeosciences, 8, 2461-2479, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5194/bg-8-2461-2011" target="_blank">10.5194/bg-8-2461-2011</a>.<br /><br />Sedwick, P. N., T. M. Church, A. R. Bowie, C. M. Marsay, S. J. Ussher, K. M. Achilles, P. J. Lethaby, R. J. Johnson, M. M. Sarin, and D. J. McGillicuddy (2005), Iron in the Sargasso Sea (Bermuda Atlantic Time-series Study region) during summer: Eolian imprint, spatiotemporal variability, and ecological implications, Global Biogeochemical Cycles, 19, GB4006, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1029/2004GB002445" target="_blank">10.1029/2004GB002445</a>.<br /><br />Sedwick, P. N., A. R. Bowie, and T. W. Trull (2008), Dissolved iron in the Australian sector of the Southern Ocean (CLIVAR-SR3 section): meridional and seasonal trends, Deep-Sea Research I, 55, 911-925, doi: <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.dsr.2008.03.011" target="_blank">10.1016/j.dsr.2008.03.011</a>.</p>

<p><strong>Data processing:</strong><br />Following subtraction of appropriate blank values, sample concentrations were calculated using least-square linear regressions fit to daily calibration curves that were obtained by additions of iron and iron(II) standard solutions to low-iron seawater.</p><p><strong>Note on concentration units: </strong>All analyses were performed on a volumetric basis, so all concentrations are reported in units of nanomole liter-1 (nM). To convert to units of nmol kg-1, divide the nM concentrations by 1.024 kg l-1 (the approximate density of seawater at a laboratory temperature of 20 degrees C).</p><p><strong>BCO-DMO Processing Notes:</strong><br />Converted original lon values in decimal degrees west to negative values (decimal degrees east); added column for official cruise_id and for cruise_part; converted original date from dd/mm/yyyy format to date in yyyymmdd format; added 'nd' to indicate 'no data' for depths not sampled; changed parameter names; added basic GEOTRACES metadata (see below).</p><p><strong>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:</strong><br />After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.<br /><br />Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.<br /><br />A standardized BCO-DMO method (called "join") was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.<br /><br />If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the names of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.<br /><br />See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: GO-FLO Teflon Trace Metal Instrument Name: GO-FLO Teflon Trace Metal Bottle Instrument Short Name:GO-FLO Teflon TM Instrument Description: GO-FLO Teflon-lined Trace Metal free sampling bottles are used for collecting water samples for trace metal, nutrient and pigment analysis. The GO-FLO sampling bottle is designed specifically to avoid sample contamination at the surface, internal spring contamination, loss of sample on deck (internal seals), and exchange of water from different depths. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/30/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: GeoFish Instrument Name: GeoFish Towed near-Surface Sampler Instrument Short Name:GeoFish Instrument Description: The GeoFish towed sampler is a custom designed near surface (<2m) sampling system for the collection of trace metal clean seawater. It consists of a PVC encapsulated lead weighted torpedo and separate PVC depressor vane supporting the intake utilizing all PFA Teflon tubing connected to a deck mounted, air-driven, PFA Teflon dual-diaphragm pump which provides trace-metal clean seawater at up to 3.7L/min. The GeoFish is towed at up to 13kts off to the side of the vessel outside of the ship's wake to avoid possible contamination from the ship's hull. It was developed by Geoffrey Smith and Ken Bruland (University of California, Santa Cruz). Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/31/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
